description: topup is part of FSL and is used to estimate and correct for susceptibility-induced distortions in echo planar imaging (EPI) data.

datain.title: Data file
datain.description: Name of text file with PE directions/times

out.title: Output basename
out.description: Base-name of output files (spline coefficients (Hz) and movement parameters)

fout.title: Field output file
fout.description: Name of image file with field (Hz)

iout.title: Unwarped images file
iout.description: Name of 4D image file with unwarped images

warpres.title: Warp resolution
warpres.description: (Approximate) resolution (in mm) of warp basis for the different sub-sampling levels, default 10

fwhm.title: Gaussian smoothing kernel
fwhm.description: FWHM (in mm) of gaussian smoothing kernel, default 8

config.title: Config file
config.description: Name of config file specifying command line arguments

lambda.title: Regularisation weight
lambda.description: Weight of regularisation, default depending on --ssqlambda and --regmod switches. See user documentation.

ssqlambda.title: Weighted lambda flag
ssqlambda.description: If set (=1), lambda is weighted by current ssq, default 1

regmod.title: Regularisation model
regmod.description: Model for regularisation of warp-field [membrane_energy bending_energy], default bending_energy

splineorder.title: Spline order
splineorder.description: Order of spline, 2=Quadratic spline, 3=Cubic spline. Default=3

numprec.title: Numerical precision
numprec.description: Precision for representing Hessian, double or float. Default double

interp.title: Interpolation model
interp.description: Image interpolation model, linear or spline. Default spline

scale.title: Scale images
scale.description: If set (=1), the images are individually scaled to a common mean, default 0 (false)

regrid.title: Regrid calculations
regrid.description: If set (=1), the calculations are done in a different grid, default 1 (true)

nthr.title: Number of threads
nthr.description: Number of threads to use (cannot be greater than numbers of hardware cores), default 1
